attributes.action: A rule for one is a rule for all
attributes.additional_details:
For too long, Britain has been allowing exceptions to law and generally accepted rules. This is particularly evident in cases regarding religion.
I.e.
Sikhs crash helmet exemption - Sikhs can wear a turban instead of a crash helmet where everyone else is expected to have a helmet by law.
Burkha-Niqab allowable in banks/shops - A Muslim woman can choose to cover her face in a security area whereas anyone else would be expected to be identifiable.

I believe that religion should play no part whatsoever in law. If we are all truly equal then a RULE FOR ONE, MUST BE A RULE FOR ALL.

NO EXCEPTIONS regardless of your religion, race, sex, sexuality etc...
